name: Japan
notes: Growing openness to foreign workers. Unique culture and lifestyle. Language can be a barrier. Points-based HSP visa is attractive.

visa_types.name: Highly Skilled Professional (HSP) Visa
visa_types.description: Points-based visa for highly skilled workers. Best immigration option.
requirements: Points based on: education, work experience, salary, age, Japanese ability
visa_types.path_to_pr: 1 year (80+ points) or 3 years (70+ points) → PR

visa_types.name: Engineer/Specialist in Humanities Visa
visa_types.description: Standard work visa for tech and knowledge workers.
visa_types.path_to_pr: 10 years continuous residence (or switch to HSP)
tips: Most common visa for tech workers
Try to qualify for HSP instead
Can change employers with visa update

visa_types.name: Startup Visa
visa_types.description: For entrepreneurs starting businesses in designated special zones.
requirements: Business plan approved by local government
Starting business in special zone (Tokyo, Fukuoka, etc.)
visa_types.path_to_pr: Convert to Business Manager visa → eventual PR
tips: Extended to 2 years in some cities
Need to convert to Business Manager

visa_types.name: Student Visa (College of Technology/University)
visa_types.description: Study in Japan with part-time work rights.
tips: Job hunting visa for 1 year after graduation
